Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a buff-coloured slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394756) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394756)
